meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive John Anneken Deborah Smith Larry Krajewski Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6598.

td.p: John Anneken, a postdoctoral researcher from Cincinnati, Ohio
Deborah Smith, a project manager from Washington, D.C.
Larry Krajewski, a postal worker from Safety Harbor, Florida (whose 2-day cash winnings total $38,200)

tr.td: MY INVENTION WILL BE THE DEATH OF ME

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew stands overlooking a waterfall.) I\'m in this state, known for spectacular scenery such as waterfalls; Shoshone Falls, near Twin Falls, is 20 feet higher than Niagara')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew stands overlooking a waterfall.) I'm in this state, known for spectacular scenery such as waterfalls; Shoshone Falls, near Twin Falls, is 20 feet higher than Niagara

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: The play was about the murder of Thomas à Becket.)
LarryWhat is Canterbury
$9,400
JohnWhat is Canterbury?
$1,111
Canterbury')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Dramatizing a murder from the year 1170, a 1935 T.S. Eliot play aptly had its first performance in this English city')

tr.td: Dramatizing a murder from the year 1170, a 1935 T.S. Eliot play aptly had its first performance in this English city
